text: Making the Shortcake Preheat oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and prepare three round 8-inch cake pans.  Bring together the dry ingredients in a food processor.  Add the chilled butter, continuing to mix until the mixture bears a resemblance to coarse crumbs.  Distribute 1-3/4 cups of the cream throughout. Gently knead the dough until smooth. Turn out the dough onto a floured surface and split into three portions. Press each one into a prepared cake pan, making sure each dough division is very smooth. Bake at 375 °F (191 °C) for about 25 minutes or until golden brown.  Remove from the oven and let the separate layers cool for approximately five minutes in pans.  Making the Cream Topping Combine heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer until soft yet stiff peaks form. Keep refrigerated until ready to use. Slice two packages (16 oz. each) of strawberries into quarters. Keep the strawberries plain or mix with sugar in a separate bowl. Assembly Place the first layer of shortcake on a serving plate. Top it with a single layer of strawberries. Layer it with about one third of the chilled whipped cream and spread it evenly. Add the second layer of cake, again layering equal amounts of strawberries and whipped cream atop the crunchy, spongy shortcake.  Add the final layer of cake and finish the remaining whipped cream and strawberries by spreading them evenly on the top of the cake.  Serve it up immediately.
